page.title: 13HIGHER OAKSHOTT FARM
page.content: {Oakshott}is a hamlet nestling in the folds of the hangers half way between Steep Marsh & Hawkley.Higher Oakshott Farm,situated at the north end of the hamlet,once had a 50 acre hop garden. 17 yrs ago they took up dairy farming, with a herd of 120 cows.Now the family breed horses-the trend towards Horsi- -culture being prevalent in the area at present.The mother of one of their foals won last year's Huntworld Cup at Hawley,Surrey.The barn at Higher Oakshott farm is nearly 300 years old and has been burnt down twice.Oakshott village isn't really a village at all. It consists of a row of farms which straddle the road. First comes Lower Oakshott Farm.Just to the north comes Middle Oakshott Farm.Further to the north,still,comes Higher Oakshott Farm situated on high ground.They still dry hops in the 4 storey barn there.
